{{cpp/title|skipws|noskipws}}
{{cpp/io/manip/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|ios}}
{{dcl|num=1|
std::ios_base&amp; skipws( std::ios_base&amp; str );
}}
{{dcl|num=2|
std::ios_base&amp; noskipws( std::ios_base&amp; str );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Enables or disables skipping of leading whitespace by the formatted input functions (enabled by default). Has no effect on output.

@1@ Enables the {{tt|skipws}} flag in the stream {{c|str}} as if by calling {{c|str.setf(std::ios_base::skipws)}}.

@2@ Disables the {{tt|skipws}} flag in the stream {{c|str}} as if by calling {{c|str.unsetf(std::ios_base::skipws)}}.

The whitespace skipping is performed by the constructor of {{lc|std::basic_istream::sentry}}, which reads and discards the characters classified as whitespace by the {{lc|std::ctype}} facet of the stream's imbued locale.

This is an I/O manipulator, it may be called with an expression such as {{c|out &lt;&lt; std::noskipws}} for any {{tt|out}} of type {{lc|std::basic_ostream}} or with an expression such as {{c|in &gt;&gt; std::noskipws}} for any {{tt|in}} of type {{lc|std::basic_istream}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|str|reference to I/O stream}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|str}} (reference to the stream after manipulation).

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;sstream&gt;

int main()
{
    char c1, c2, c3;
    std::istringstream("a b c") &gt;&gt; c1 &gt;&gt; c2 &gt;&gt; c3;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Default  behavior:"
                 " c1 = " &lt;&lt; c1 &lt;&lt; 
                 " c2 = " &lt;&lt; c2 &lt;&lt; 
                 " c3 = " &lt;&lt; c3 &lt;&lt; '\n';
    std::istringstream("a b c") &gt;&gt; std::noskipws &gt;&gt; c1 &gt;&gt; c2 &gt;&gt; c3;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "noskipws behavior:" 
                 " c1 = " &lt;&lt; c1 &lt;&lt;
                 " c2 = " &lt;&lt; c2 &lt;&lt;
                 " c3 = " &lt;&lt; c3 &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
Default  behavior: c1 = a c2 = b c3 = c
noskipws behavior: c1 = a c2 =   c3 = b
}}
